body:
Comment 6 by **ejsherry**: 
I think this should be reopened. The problem isn't buggy hardware; it's the precision of
the x87. The x86 defaults to double extended precision (64-bit significand) and in this
mode the math routines work well. Changing the x87 to double precision (53-bit
significand) you get nikolai's results.

I think the x87 should be placed into a known state (double extended) or the ASM
routines should assume at most double precision.
